content.question: Let <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a differentiable function such that <math alttext="g of 3, equals 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g prime of 3, equals, negative three fourths " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The graph of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></math> is concave down on the interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 2 comma 4, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.
